newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonia hopes to solve dispute with SAS.
newsitem.headline: Estonia hopes to solve dispute with SAS.

text.p: Officials from Estonia and Scandinavian Airlines hoped to solve a dispute over flights between Tallinn and Copenhagen during a second day of talks on Wednesday, the Estonian Civil Aviation office said.
A spokeswoman said the two sides hoped they could reach agreement in the row, which began at the end of October.
"The negotiations are difficult and we have until November 15 to reach a solution as that is when the new winter timetable will start," the spokeswoman told Reuters.
Estonian Air, part-owned by Danish airline Maersk, has asked SAS to cut its flights to Copenhagen to one a day from two.
Estonian Air, which is restarting flights to Copenhagen after a gap, says there is too much capacity on the route but SAS rejects this argument.
SAS is also involved in a flight dispute in neighbouring Latvia. It has a big stake in Latvian carrier Air Baltic, which is pushing to be allowed to fly to Moscow.
Russian carrier Aeroflot was forced to suspend its Moscow-Riga flights after Latvia refused to confirm its winter timetable in view of the dispute.
